metadata.feature_description: Search for users and filter by various status criteria

steps.action: Navigate to Users section via Manage > Users
steps.expected: Users panel displays with search and filter controls
steps.actual: Users panel displayed with search box and filter dropdown showing 'Authorized' filter

steps.action: Type 'claude' in search box and press Enter
steps.expected: Search results filter to show users matching 'claude'
steps.actual: Search results filtered to show only 'Claude TestUser' with email claudetest@test.com

steps.action: Type 'testuser5@test.com' in search box and press Enter
steps.expected: Search results filter to show user matching the email
steps.actual: Search results filtered to show only 'Test User5' with email testuser5@test.com

steps.action: Click on filter dropdown to view available options
steps.actual: Dropdown displayed with options: Authorized, Unauthorized, Deleted, Superusers, All

steps.action: Verify Authorized filter shows authorized users
steps.actual: Filter showed 17 authorized users including Regular TestUser, Claude TestUser, etc.

steps.expected: List displays unauthorized users or shows empty state if none exist
steps.actual: Filter correctly showed 'No users found.' indicating no unauthorized users in the system

steps.expected: List displays deleted users or shows empty state if none exist
steps.actual: Filter correctly showed 'No users found.' indicating no deleted users in the system
Filter correctly showed 1 superuser: 'SuperUser Account' (host) with email chetan.verma@ignitetech.com

steps.expected: List displays all users regardless of status
steps.actual: Filter correctly showed 18 total users including DeleteTest User, Regular TestUser, Claude TestUser, and other test users

steps.action: Set filter to 'Authorized' and search for 'regular'
steps.expected: Results should be filtered by both criteria - authorized users matching 'regular'
steps.actual: Combined filtering worked correctly - showed only 'Regular TestUser' which is an authorized user matching 'regular'

steps.expected: Search should find users regardless of case, matching 'Claude TestUser'
steps.actual: Case-insensitive search worked correctly - 'CLAUDE' uppercase search found 'Claude TestUser' (mixed case)

steps.action: Clear the search box by deleting text and pressing Enter
steps.expected: Search should be cleared and all users within current filter should display
steps.actual: Search cleared successfully - returned to showing 18 authorized users with empty search box

observations: The filter dropdown contains 5 options: Authorized, Unauthorized, Deleted, Superusers, and All. There is NO 'Locked' filter option available in the UI despite being listed in test scenarios.
The 'All' filter shows 18 users while 'Authorized' shows 17 users, indicating 1 user (DeleteTest User) may have a different status.
Search is case-insensitive and works with both name and email fields.
Real-time search updates are functional - results update immediately after pressing Enter.
Pagination resets properly when changing filters (resetIndex flag observed in code).
